    CLI Math [WIP]

    19 Jul 2024 » cli, terminal, shell, console, math, howto

    bc(1)

    In tcsh/csh:

    $ printf %s\\n "33.59 - 20.45" | bc
13.14

    NOTE: You donâ€™t have to use a newline witn printf(1) (that is %s\\n) in FreeBSD in csh (tcsh) shell. You have to use a newline with printf(1) (that is %s\\n) on Apple Mac, a.k.a. macOS, with bash shell.

    Footnotes

    [1] From the man page for bc(1) on FreeBSD 14:

    bc(1) is an interactive processor for a language first standardized in 1991 by POSIX.
